statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description:
The Detroit Pistons were able to make
up for being without their star player.

related.description: Detroit Pistons All-Star Jerry Stackhouse will miss Sunday night's game against the Houston Rockets to rest a nagging groin injury.
related.linkText: Pistons sit injured Stackhouse against Rockets
related.title: Stackhouse sidelined with nagging groin injury
related.headline: Stackhouse sidelined with nagging groin injury

related.description: Houston Rockets, losers of eight games in a row, got more bad news Thursday with the determination that forward Glen Rice will miss at least two weeks with a sore knee.
related.linkText: Rockets' Rice out 7-10 days with tendon injury in knee
related.title: Rockets already reeling after eight straight defeats
related.headline: Rockets already reeling after eight straight defeats

article.headline: Houston, without Francis, now has lost 10 in a row

images.name: Barry_Jon 011209 inline
images.caption: Detroit's Jon Barry tries to slide past Houston's Cuttino Mobley on his way to a team-high 15 points.

article.linkText: Even without Stackhouse, Pistons blow away Rockets
article.story:
AUBURN HILLS, Mich. (AP) -- The Detroit Pistons were able to make up for being without their star player. And they took advantage of the Houston Rockets' inability to compensate for missing theirs. Jon Barry had 15 points, and Ben Wallace added 10 points and a season-high 18 rebounds to lead Detroit, which was without Jerry Stackhouse, to a 105-77 rout of slumping Houston on Sunday night. "Obviously, we aren't the same team without Stack as we are with him, but our guys have really been stepping up," Pistons coach Rick Carlisle said. "When Jerry isn't there, we know we need some balanced scoring, and we have been getting four or five guys in double figures every time." The Pistons improved to 3-1 this season without Stackhouse, who missed the game with a groin injury. The Rockets, meanwhile, have lost the last 13 games Steve Francis has missed. Cuttino Mobley scored 17 points for Houston, which lost its 10th in a row -- the team's longest skid since a 10-game slide to start the 1982-83 season. The Rockets also were missing Glen Rice and Kelvin Cato. "We have to face facts -- we are just undermanned," Rockets coach Rudy Tomjanovich said. "There's nobody that wants to go through this. You try too hard and it is tough." Detroit's margin of victory was its largest against Houston, surpassing two 27-point victories over the then-San Diego Rockets. The Pistons also stayed on top of the Eastern Conference, improving to 13-6. "We stopped talking about fixing our defense and just did it," said Ben Wallace, who had 10 points and a season-best 18 rebounds. "We worked hard, we filled passing lanes and we got to the boards." Houston led for much of the first quarter, but Detroit's 11-3 rebounding edge in the period helped them take a 28-23 lead at the end of the period. Barry said the team knew they needed good defense to make up for the loss of Stackhouse. "After our first timeout, we were down 11-4, but after that, we really brought it," he said. "Our defensive effort from that point on was just tremendous. That's how we played early in the year, and that's our team." The Pistons blew the game open by outscoring Houston 27-13 in the second quarter. Detroit led by as many as 22 in the quarter before going into halftime with a 55-36 lead. "I don't have an answer for this," Houston center Kevin Willis said. "It is mind-boggling. You can only use being undermanned as an excuse for so many games. I don't remember losing like this before in my career, but I have to stay positive. We will turn this around." Any hopes of a Houston comeback were ended by Detroit's 13-2 run to start the second half. Dana Barros led the surge with five points, helping the Pistons build a 30-point lead, 68-38. Houston didn't reach 50 points until Kenny Thomas' free throw with 2:02 left in the third quarter. "We're playing the game for the love of it, but it is also our job, so we have to play hard every day -- even when we don't want to," said a frustrated Moochie Norris. "Tonight, we missed some key assignments and that put us in a hole that we just couldn't get out of." Game notes
Barry briefly left the game in the third quarter after a spectacular flip over a row of seats while chasing a loose ball. Barry suffered a small cut to his nose, and a fan needed minor medical attention after being kicked in the forehead by Barry as he landed. ... The Rockets have lost the last 13 games they have played without Francis. ... Detroit is 10-3 against the Rockets at home since moving to the Palace of Auburn Hills.
